website_summaries.verdict: Powerful cooling power combined with awesome color- changing technology make this is a seriously sexy cooling option for your tower.
pros: RGB LEDs that can be synced with other EVGA hardware, and a full copper water block that pulls heat away from your CPU, this CPU cooler combines newer technology and sleek looks to bring one cool unit
cons: Installation instructions can be a bit vague and this model does not always seem to work well with AMD processors

website_summaries.verdict: A good option for an affordable liquid cooling system with additional perks like RGB lighting.
pros: 240-millimeter dual fan radiator offers nearly twice the surface area as standard fans and single-fan cooling setups
Colored lights are controllable via PC software
Software allows for monitoring and adjustments
cons: Known compatability issues with Ryzen CPUs and the built-in Flow Control software

customer_reviews.title: Great cooling, loud fans
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up about 3 months ago for a 4.5GHz overclocked Intel i5-2500K processor. I frequently have all 4 cores maxed out when gaming, temps are always kept below 50C. One note, the stock fans are effective however quite loud at maximum speed, I ended up swapping them out for a set of PWM magnetic levitation bearing fans,now I have the same cooling performance in a much quieter package. RGB function is a great novelty, I also have an EVGA graphics card, and the software syncs the LEDs together which is a great added touch. I'll certainly be using this for my i7-8700K build in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scott

customer_reviews.title: Maybe get a new one, I'd avoid any used ones
customer_reviews.text: I like this cooler. It works great for my 8700k up to 4.9 GHz. Problem with the main device is that it can be a bit tricky to setup. To enable in windows 10 (1803) -Install the evga flow software (IMPORTANT, the program will fail to detect the device, this is normal) -Device manager -USB devices (it could also be under unkown devices) -uninstall any ccv or weird names with "cc" as part of the name (or try anything you don't recognize) -restart -start evga software Should work fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Jhon

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good cooler
customer_reviews.text: After more time with this cooler, I think it is actually quite good. When paired with Noctua 140mm fans, I got a pretty nice overclock out of my 3700x with acceptably low noise. The pump noise is essentially silent with this cooler as well, which is nice. If you're looking for a 280mm cooler for a good price, I'd definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderful so far. XPS 8930 install
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that my PC was not designed for this. That being said I love it. Paired with a Noctua slim it keeps my i5 8400 running 20 degrees cooler than it did before. Turbo goes from base of 2.8GHZ to 3.9 without coming over 156 degrees on any core at very high usage. I purchased this in preparation of upgrading to an i9 9900 and am still waiting for an order with another noctua slim. I have no doubt that even with this small case I’ll keep temps at nominal for the i9. Update: I have installed the i9 9900k and this cooler keeps it within very acceptable temps even with a conservative oc.
customer_reviews.author: k412white

customer_reviews.title: nice Rad nice Temps
customer_reviews.text: all working as advertised,was a little worried about the hoses being a little smaller in diameter but does not appear to effect the running what so ever.great AIO rad setup at a competitive price.i guess if i had to choose 1 con that would be the fans with this type of design.kinda leaves only the push option open seeing as a pull configuration would pull air from the sides of the fan shroud.this is not an issue for me as im not using the fans but something to consider if your going to be using them.still giving 5 stars because you can achieve top AIO cooling performance with this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: guydodge

customer_reviews.title: Works with Kraken g12!
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest AIO I could find that would fit the Kraken G12. Has a slight humming noise but with headphones on you can’t hear anything. Used this with the g12 on my gtx1080 founders edition. Lowered the temps a ton!
customer_reviews.author: Blake mcKinley

customer_reviews.title: An otherwise excellent AIO that is held back by terrible fans
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice RGB lighting/effects. Easy to install on AM4. Good build quality (see Cons) Evga Flow software seems okay. Water pump is silent. Cons: Tiny washers used during install. Terribly noisy fans. In their lowest RPM, they emit this groaning noise that drones. They are actually quieter at mid-RPM, but that defeats the point. Replaced them with Arctic F12 PWM fans. All is good now. Just stinks that you have to do this out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: E.Yang

customer_reviews.title: NOISY!  Like a coffee grinder and a pee stream in a toilet.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if these are hit-or-miss but I'll be returning it. VERY NOISY. First started off with a coffee grinder sound for about 2 minutes then settle into a slightly crunchy pee stream hitting a puddle. Even if this is how it's supposed to operate, can't do anything with that noise.
customer_reviews.author: Porkchop

customer_reviews.title: Great AIO BUT......
customer_reviews.text: This is a great AIO. It would be a fantastic AIO if it didn't come the most incredibly loud fans I've ever encountered. How loud can the be? Glad you asked. At full speed you can literally hear this thing outside my front door. Yes, the door is closed. Sitting beside the machine is just not doable when the fans ramp up. I replaced the trash fans on this unit and now it's fantastic. EVGA, come on. If you're gonna make a closed loop cooler put some descent fans on it.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Collins

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, effective, easy to install, looks great and really good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my PC as when I built a new one for my friend, i was amazed at how quiet it was. I was expecting a 280mm rad to be quite noisy under stress but surprisingly it was way quieter than h80i. CPU does not go beyond 45 degrees. I own a Haswell CPU. I highly recommend the product. Good quality. Will update the review after couple months as I just installed it and I can only comment on quality and noise level.
customer_reviews.author: ILuvShopping

customer_reviews.title: EVGA = loud but effective
customer_reviews.text: I really wouldn't buy this unless you're installing aftermarket fans. EVGA's fans are trash. They spin up quickly and get loud easily. This specific model is only effective at shedding heat at 1200RPM and above - any less and it just doesn't get enough negative pressure. All that being said, though, the software is amazing and you don't have to keep it running (the software) for the AIO to remember what it's supposed to do. Install software, run it once, click apply, close the software and never run it again. The entire unit also only takes ONE 4-pin fan header and one USB header. Yes, USB.
customer_reviews.author: Casey M Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: but installation was easy and it works well
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a day, but installation was easy and it works well. Brought my old work horse 2500k @4.5 GHz down to 33 degrees idle. Tubes unexpectedly are indeed long enough to mount In a Thermaltake P5 without the AIO bracket. I'd say they are about 37 cm long. Thanks EVGA for the longer tubes! Wish the EVGA logo was the other way around or turnable, but whatever.
customer_reviews.author: McSquid

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN CORSAIR H60
customer_reviews.text: I am using an Intel 7700k processor for an ITX build. I have a NCASE M1 so it's super small. I was originally using a Corsair H60, and I was seriously unhappy with its performance. There was no way I could fit a dual radiator in my case, so I switched with EVGA, and boy am I satisfied. Idle temps stays a good steady 35C, from 45C - 50C Under load max temp stays at 70C, from 90C Seriously everyone, go with EVGA if you have to choose between it and Corsair. EVGA makes quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Tran

customer_reviews.title: It fits and ryzen 5 7 and 9 series well.
customer_reviews.text: It will fit the ryzens well 5 7 9 I own amd 9 3900x amd 9 3950x amd 7 3800x fits well and works well. it is too small for the thread rippers I have amd 3960x i have amd 3970x I do not recommend this cooler as its plate does not cover the thread ripper fully. I use be quiet air coolers for my thread rippers.
customer_reviews.author: philipma1957

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I would have recommended this product but I'm noticing droplets of moisture appear on the inside of my build next to the hoses. EDIT: I've come to find that those mysterious droplets of moisture weren't water based and led me to research what else could be the issue. To those who don't know much about PC hardware, PC fans have bearings that may have lubricant/oil. This oil was the culprit and not the cooler. Overall, I'm glad it wasn't the cooler, its working just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ramiz Haddad

customer_reviews.title: Well made, fairly quiet and it works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to use in a Thermaltake core P5 case and it just fits, the hoses are about 100mm longer than the unit itself. The unit is very well made and the material quality seems good to me. It's also pretty quiet when the fans are below 1k rpm. That said, it's not silent, you can hear a distinct sound from the fans that some describe as 'coil whine' though I only notice it when the room is dead quiet. Since I wanted a silent build, I ended up replacing the fans with a set of be quiet fans. Even so, I'm very pleased with what I got for my money and would happily buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for the first month, and then all of a sudden my computer started making the noise for "new device connected", "new device disconnected" over and over again. After unplugging every USB device attached to my computer, I finally realized that this item was the cause. I tried using a different USB header on the motherboard to no avail. Once I removed the USB cable it stopped rebooting and the fans started spinning again, but I have zero confidence the pump is working. And without being able to monitor it, I'm definitely going to replace it with a different device.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Theobald

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, below average fans
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooler. DO NOT MOUNT FANS IN "PULL". Meaning do not mount the fans in a way where they are pulling air through the radiator. Set them up in push. When in pull, the fans "fight" for air causing them to fall off balance and make a grinding noise. I believe this is a flaw from the design of the fan shroud/case. It has curved dips along each 4 edges which causes air to be pulled to both fans. A normal "box" would eliminate this issue. 4790k @4.6ghz 1.25v does not go past (peaks) at 64C and usually idles at 55C with pump set to 100% and fans set to 40%.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 280mm radiator space.
customer_reviews.text: The product I got was sold as new, but the radiator has scratches, as someone tried to mount it previously. The pump however had it's thermal paste applied as if new. I could not fit this in two different PC cases in top and front mounting positions. Both cases were advertised as compatible with 280mm radiators. I guess someone had the same problem before, and that explains the scratches on the radiator. I really like EVGA video cards, but this product is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: wk

customer_reviews.title: Great CLC!
customer_reviews.text: When I made the jump to the i5-8600k, my fan cooler wasn't doing a good job. It I was hitting about 60-70c with a 4.9ghz overclock. So I decided to try out an aio cooler. After doing some research, I decided upon Evga aio. The price was good for this range of cooler, good reviews and it's backed by Evga's warranty. The fans can be a bit loud when you ramp their speed, but with some adjusting of the curve it should be easier to deal with. Now? My 4.9ghz overclock is running 51c at max temps. This clc is a great buy and Evga made a darn good product.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Keeping cool, easy install
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a graphics card, but ending up using it on a Threadripper 1950x. I had some misgivings on whether it would be enough cooling power for a TR, so I put another 120mm fan on the radiator so it had two fans. Running mPrime / Prime95 for an hour on 32 cores, after an hour I was only in the mid 50's C and ~2800 RPM fan speed...this thing is doing great! Install was easy, and build quality seems fine. It's only been running for a few weeks now, so can't speak to longer term durability yet, but I'm pleased so far. I'd definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Olson

customer_reviews.title: Workinggggg!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints on the cooking side ,but I did remove the fans and replaced them. Why because they are too damn nosey.
customer_reviews.author: Blackipods

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the fans are terrible
customer_reviews.text: Static pressure was good, quality is good, but the noise level is unbearable. Save yourself the time and order some noctua ippm 2000s. Same static pressure, but they are barely audible under 1500 rpm.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Great value for $60. Watercooling my GPU.
customer_reviews.text: Cover over pump is flimsy plastic that will break easily. The AIO does a decent job, and very quiet since changing the fans. I used this AIO with a Kraken G12 on a founders edition 2080 super. Max temp of 60C and isles at 35C.
customer_reviews.author: traustic

customer_reviews.title: EFFECTIVE, QUIET, EASILY-INSTALLED CLC
customer_reviews.text: This CPU cooler works very well. It keeps my 9900k at 53C or lower under max load and between 30 and 43 under lesser loads. Switching the airflow direction is easy. I would not call the fans “super” quiet, but neither are they especially loud except when set manually at 100%. Using EVGA Flow Control software makes their auditory volume unnoticeable and the pump inaudible in a closed case. I have used other CLC’s and this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Decent cooling system for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Working well on my Ryzen 7 2700. Only during intense gaming will my CPU temp get above 50C. The software is "okay". I mean it does the job. What I do like about the software is the K button which basically cranks all fans to 100% until depressed. You can also customize the LED color to coordinate with CPU temps. I have 40C blue, 50C green, 70C red. I replaced the fans with some beefy Corsair fans. I can't really compare it to the stock system as I never even tried the stock heat sync/fan that came with my processor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin F

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Card, 4 STARS Due to {NO BACK PLATE!!!!}
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Card, Only gave 4 Stars because this model does not have a backplate it is exposed PCD, and for that price they should have added one like the one on the 2080, Now I will have to spend extra money and time to make or have a backplate made, I can't seems to find any stock ones that will fit it, I am going to contact EVGA for support, also the Flow Control software throws wrong temp readings in all versions.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great temps but huge and weird mounting decisions.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure your case can fit this. Don't expect to find more of the same fans for this one. If you want more fans just buy 4 identical ones. The fans have an open side design. I mounted them on the outside of the case front underneath the front panel. For maximized airflow. Didn't want them pulling air from the inside. Just wish I had a mesh front panel. Have to remove front panel while gaming.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Really good product
customer_reviews.text: ZERO hassle with LGA 2066 - just slap that thing right on your motherboard and batten down the thumbscrews. My 7800X is running upper 20’s / lower 30’s idle and hasn’t climbed above 50 even under full load for extended periods. Once the CPU usage drops, it cools back to idle in less than half a minute. I really like this integrated solution; I wasn’t afraid to pay a bit extra, and I’m not disappointed. The unit succeeds wildly in keeping this 3.5ghz 6-core i7at temps just above ambient.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Performance is great, but there are noticeable flaws on ryzen.
customer_reviews.text: ISSUES WITH THIS COOLER ARE NOT NECESSARILY EVGA'S FAULT. RYZEN has temp reporting issues and because of this it has rendered the flow controll software useless, on a brand new windows install flow will not even run, it will be in back ground but not display any program, people with better luck report that it cannot even read the cpu temp. This cooler is around 90$ THIS NEEDS TO BE FIXED. Cooling oerformance is fine but i am forced to controll my fans with my motherboard and the pump from a dedicated waterpump header on my motherboard, i hope you have one too.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Seems of quality. Not that loud (InWin 101)
customer_reviews.text: This CLC cooler seems to be of good quality and works good so far at keeping my Ryzen 2 2700X cool under load while running an RTX 2070. It will hover around 55c while playing Tomb Raider. I have the 280mm model and installed it in the InWin 101 on the side where the two exhaust fans would go. I had questions about fitment and most places said it will only fit across the bottom. But it can be wedge into the side by removing the plastic fan shroud that comes with the case. It is only attached by 4 screws. See pictures for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto B

customer_reviews.title: MINE was extremely noisy
customer_reviews.text: Ill start off by saying that I personally NEVER review anything on amazon but this thing was absolutely unacceptable on noise level. I dont know if mine was defective however to give a description of its sound while running anywhere above 45% pump speed.... imagine an air compressor and scale down the size and the loudness. It made that kind of noise, the way an air compressors sound makes a rattling kind of vibration. I expected much more judging by most of the reviews here which is why Im not positive that mine wasnt defective but the noise level was just absolutely unacceptable when it overpowered my ambient room fan, and my noise cancelling headphones...
customer_reviews.author: jacob anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works with Kraken g12
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use as an exhaust fan paired with the nzxt kraken g12 to cool my gpu. It does fit, but as other reviews have stated you just have to loosen the 4 screws before twisting it into the bracket and then you can tighten the screws again. My gpu runs about ~20c cooler now. Make sure the tubes are facing the right way before twisting it in! I do wish that it had nicer sleeving for the tubes similar to the corsair h100i braided tubes. This one is just rubbery material.
customer_reviews.author: Tan Y.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend buying
customer_reviews.text: Includes AM4 mounts. Reduced my Ryzen 1600 @ 3.8 GHz from around 41 degrees C idle to around 29C idle. It never gets warmer than 50C even running firestrike. The included fans are not too loud but definitely not the quietest AIO I have owned. According to tests of youtube tech tubers the fans actually work better if you tape up the sides where they are opened. I am debating purchasing fans to replace the stock ones. Other than that it has been voted one of the best AIO coolers by Gamers Nexus.
customer_reviews.author: Ryoga Hibiki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler! Just need EVGA to update driver to utilize CPU temp on 350 MOBO. Ryzen 1600 (OC @ 3.9 / 1.3875v) Asrock 350m pro Evga 550w SuperNova G3 Evga 120 CLC cooler G Skill 3200 (2x8gb) Fractual Design Define Mini C case
customer_reviews.author: B16borangecx

customer_reviews.title: Great RGB Cooler from EVGA
customer_reviews.text: This is currently cooling down my main rig running a Ryzen 7 1700. I will come back and review more as I overclock the chip. The cooler performs well, installs (on AM4) like a dream, and the software is great for changing the RGB, it is recognized as Asetek. The fan is fairly quiet. My only gripe is the software had trouble reading temps on my motherboard/cpu, but that is expected it being a couple moth old chipset. All in all, this is a great cooler from EVGA.
customer_reviews.author: EzD

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: cooling perfect, software sucks,. crashes, cant find cpu temps. Renstalled windows 10, now works as descrbed, cools a Delidded I7-8086k at 5.3 Ghz 1.39 vdc. never gets over 80c. Can got to 5.4 but temps a bit to high 94-95. Changed to Psh Pull with 3 120 rgb fans in both sides. Pump Quiet. can set rgb to cpu temps, or match case fans, Bt don't work with Aura Software, need a spare usb port on board, or use usb to usb-b cabke and hook up to regular usb port.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D Dees

customer_reviews.title: No complaints with 280mm performance.
customer_reviews.text: The CL28 RGB is a fantastic AIO cooler. I'm running my Intel 9600kf at 4.8 GHz and this keeps the temperature below 76 Celsius no matter what I'm running or for how long. It is rather noisy if operating at full bore, but under normal load (even at 4.8 GHz) it is much quieter than my previous air cooler and barely noticeable. Installation can be a little fiddly depending on your other components, but was a painless experience overall. I couldn't be happier with this bit of gear. It has made overclocking simple and worry free.
customer_reviews.author: wallinator

customer_reviews.title: Not (readily) compatible with NZXT G12 video card bracket
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this (open box) to fit on an RX 580 that ran extremely hot with an NZXT G12 bracket (also open box). The internet led me to believe that the G12 and the cooler were compatible. The decorative plastic on the cooler creates a problem with the twist-on attachment and with the mounting screws. However, with some real struggling, the cooler will fit VERY securely. Add some different screws, steal the washers, and it fits together and provided a major improvement to video card temperatures and noise level. I have not owned this long enough for a verdict on pump life or leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Can't belive -- does this cooler have water?
customer_reviews.text: This liquid cooler brought my server, which idled at about 55 - 56 degrees, down to 46 - 48 degrees idle and 51 when in use. There are no crazy parts or a tank (as far as I can find). Finally a cpu cooler that is a newbie's best friend.
customer_reviews.author: E.D.S

customer_reviews.title: Item installation guide was wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I like this item but found a problem with installation guide, when I contacted to Amazon, they redirected me back to EVGA support. I send them picture of the item and installation guide. here is what they wrote me back. "My apologies for the confusing manual. It's going to be corrected for the next release. We'll also be adding an updated version to the website." Anyways, the product is working fine with my build and I have using it with non-overclocking system. Thank you Zaheen
customer_reviews.author: Zaheen

customer_reviews.title: Just my luck
customer_reviews.text: First one I ordered never arrived, I order a second time and it’s not working properly. Install was pretty simple but when I started setup up in my bios it wasn’t reading any cpu fan, and the fan software says no device detected. I double checked with other cpu fans and they work fine so not sure if it’s just a bad software. I plugged the fans separately and they work, so must be the pump itself. My temps did stay low no issues there so pump was still working just not Picking up fan rpm signal. I could change fan rpm speed and it would change but rpms would always be at 0. Might just go with other brand.
customer_reviews.author: DIANNA

customer_reviews.title: Cools Fine, Stock Fans are Loud
customer_reviews.text: Currently using this cooler on a Ryzen 7 1800X. Can handle my overclocked CPU with ease. Lowest Temp: 30C Average: 35-40C Highest Temp: 60C Stock fans are trash though, at least the ones that came with mine. Can hear a whirring sound whenever RPM increased. Had to order another set of fans to replace them. Overall I'm happy with the purchase. Just keep in mind you may or may not have to replace the pre-installed fans.
customer_reviews.author: Panda Bear

customer_reviews.title: Good performance
customer_reviews.text: Loud very loud but I knew that when I bought it. I bought 3 fans for this because I heard it was loud and planned on changing them but I chose not to put them on because I get more thermal headroom for overclocking. I have closed ear headphone so it blocks out alot of noise, and mic canceling so people don't hear it that much on the mic and I'm 2 feet away. On another note I have everything running full bore and OC-Ed so the noise doesn't bother me most days. I liked the look of it just enough rgb.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very loud but performs well
customer_reviews.text: Seriously loud. Highly recommend getting a bunch of noctua fans as a replacement. +$60 to your cost for all 3 60mm fans to be replaced (and thrown out because they are so loud). If you have any sensitivity to noise or want to think properly without blaring music, Get DIFFERENT Fans. Otherwise the clc performance is excellent and cools the cpu well.
customer_reviews.author: fengelhardt

customer_reviews.title: Evga. Fix your software. Updated
customer_reviews.text: Amazing cooler nearly crippled by bad software. The software wont load half the time i attempt to start it and when it does start it sometimes wont give me coolant or pump readings I attempted to by-pass the software fully and run the pump and fan stacks straight from my fan headers and pump headers but for some reason that wouldn't work. UPDATE: I just installed at Ryzen 3800X and Gigabyte elite wifi Same numbers! 50c-65c Idle-load. I'm going back to air cooling after this. How upsetting and sad.
customer_reviews.author: Delete

customer_reviews.title: Low Budget, Low Quality?
customer_reviews.text: So when it worked, the fan works well. Low noise and cool temps hovering below or at room temp for day to day use. BUT, I owned the pump for about 6 months before it failed. I found the dreaded "cpuwb" error code that says "device not found" and sure enough, the pump was dead. I am not sure it played nice with my motherboard on sleep/wake cycles. Unfortunately, I didn't know this was an issue until I checked my CPU temps and saw they were in the range of 100 deg C. Idling, mind you. Ridiculous. Wish I could get my money back to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: J Macy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooling solution for a 7700K
customer_reviews.text: I have used this since December 2018 to upgrade my old AIO which was starting to not perform as well. Excellent solution and the fans and radiator work so well in keeping my 7700K cool. At idle I have 30 degrees and then when the temps, the fan's kick into high speed and can still maintain under 65deg. The software isn't the best so I just plugged the fans into my motherboard and let the MB software (Fanxpert4) take care of the fan speeds. I would buy this again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my I7-7700K nice and cool
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my I7-7700K cool at 29-30C idle and 40 to 53C in Games. My CPU is not delid and be careful using Gallium based liquid metal as this liquid metal is corrosive to all metals except tungsten and tantalum, . "Gallium-containing alloys are very corrosive when hot; their temperature should not exceed 65 °C (149 °F)." EVGA has great customer service so if you are considering buying a CPU cooler than this is definitely a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: jerr

customer_reviews.title: Air-Con for your CPU
customer_reviews.text: I got this in anticipation of Skylake-X space heater rumors and needless to say this thing gets the job done. I run a 7800x at 4.45GHz and I am seeing temperatures of 26C idle and 66C load, with most medium computer use in the 40-55C range, with the silent fan setting. Ambient is 21C. Revving up the fans for liftoff, I shed about 4 additional C but it's not worth for the decibels. Got a little lucky and got this for just under $100 so given the $130 price as of review I must've hit the Amazon pricing lottery that day.
customer_reviews.author: Plaxer X

customer_reviews.title: Quite Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I built a new gaming rig, had a bad experience with another make pump that came doa. After installing my new Evga pump, worked like a charm. I like the style of the fans and how quiet the pump runs. My temps run 20-30 c idle and 28-40 c during heavy game play. I got the pump mainly because my system holds a Evga 750 w power core and 1070 graphics card, and they're able to sync with each other. Looks really nice when it all lights up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a large package. The fins were bent when it arrived. I've been using it for a few weeks now. You have to manually set the speed through their software. You have to reset the software every time you start up. After leaving my computer running for a few minutes, the fans go all the way up and then go back down and continually cycle that way. Their software thinks that my processor is constantly at 90° C. It was pretty time consuming to install this. The instructions aren't super clear. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: The AIO to get!!!
customer_reviews.text: This AIO is the one to have if you’re looking to overclock your cpu to high levels. You will definitely benefit from this as this keeps temps really low. One thing I think is beneficial is the flex offered by the tubes. This allows for multiple set ups and can really assist in finding the right positioning of the AIO. The software is simple and easy to use. RGB is a nice little touch. I think this AIO is the best looking one in my opinion. Give it a shot, you won’t regret this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler, mediocre instructions
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't hard to get installed. Brought my temps way down and is handling a pretty hefty OC just fine. Knocked off one star just because the instructions really need some updating and more details. Maybe a set of instructions on a board that doesn't use the included Intel backplate? Not that folks building their own PC won't "figure it out". It's just a nice touch to have detailed instructions.
customer_reviews.author: ADAM A BORCHARDT

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler but needs some improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Great Looking cooler. Performance seemed to be ok although I was not able to fully test it due to my core i7 4770K not being delidded at the time and most coolers failed to keep it cool even at stock clocks under load. The software is awfull and outdated. EVGA needs to update the software severely as it glithches and is innacurate. The rgb on the pump seems to struggle to transition among the different effects and is very slow. Overall, I think the cooler has potential if evga puts some much needed effort in to it. For a lower price, it maybe more enticing even with the afore mentioned flaws.
customer_reviews.author: victor mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Amazon does not understand
customer_reviews.text: So I been a amazon member since 2009. Today I called amazon. because I received a bokend EVGA cl 240 aio cooler and spend 75$ to install a bokend cooler. I spoke to Daniel and the Philippines that's all the information I can get out of him. He was not helpful at all. Like at I had to repeat my self like 5 time I been on the phone for over a hour. Only supervisor was helpful
customer_reviews.author: cedric

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and performance, but a little loud
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about compatibility, as this dropped right into my motherboard and has kept the CPU well within expected temperature ranges. The first thing I noticed about it compared to my previous Corsair H60 is that it is noticeably louder. If you are looking for liquid cooling for a quieter PC, I wouldn't go with this option.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad instructions.
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a really good cooler, with my idle temps at 25 C and load temps no higher than 35 C. The only issue I have with this is the installation instructions. They seem to be for the version that has a USB mini connector, and not this one exactly. The cooler also doesn’t work with the EVGA Flow Control software which I didn’t realize until after I did an hour and a half’s work of research. The cooler is way quieter than any heatsink I’ve owned and I’m very happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Deyton Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Works Well but Loud
customer_reviews.text: I had some issue with installation because it was my first build and the instructions were unclear. Speaking to EVGA cleared up some confusion. Then the cooler keeps my temps low but I can't bring myself to turn up the fan power on the radiator because it's noticeably loud, and that's coming from someone that has an AC window unit on in the same room.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Fan noise is fixable
customer_reviews.text: People who have issues with the fan noise need to realize that if you have motherboard software dictating fan speeds as well as this which is usb controlled then the software will conflict and that is why you hear loud noises. You can fix this by disabling cpu fan control in bios or setting the fan control to something less aggressive like the minimal option. You will hear a grinding noise because one is trying to rev up while one wants to rev down and it causes noise on the bearing.
customer_reviews.author: starburst2021

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Using for my new rig. First had to flip fans to accommodate for front use I already had some RGB fans at front so I set them as follows RGB fans at front of cage then radiator then stock radiator fans reversed. So in retrospect radiator is been sandwiched by fans blowing in a backwards direction into the case. The fan blow is pretty good. Will recommend that to people who have front fans and space at front and not at back like my case. Will post picks after my ram and graphics card arrive. Looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Dislikes: 1. EVGA Flow Control. I cant seem to figure a way to change the minimum or maximum fan or temperature levels. See Pic 2. The stock fans can be loud at higher RPM [I recommend using your own fans with quieter noise levels]. 3. The instructions were off for me. I have a AM4 mobo and CPU. When using Part D (the treads for AM4) it didn't fit. So if your back-plate doesn't fit the AM4 thread (part D on the instructions) try the AM3 tread to connect with the back-plate.
customer_reviews.author: AmaCheat

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cpu cool
customer_reviews.text: Its great, but its definitely not the best looking AIO, it doesn't help that the fans plug into the CPU block, which looks unseemly in what would otherwise be a clean build.
customer_reviews.author: paulbeard

customer_reviews.title: Solid cooler, fan are a little bit loud.
customer_reviews.text: I am very loyal to the EVGA brand. I have put many of there products thru the most rigorous tasks that most other companies products would fail at. I am very pleased with this cooler. I am running this cooler on an Intel i7-5930K-LGA2011v3 @ 4.5GHz. Temps stay at around 35 to 39C with no issues after about 3 months of use. The only complaint I have about this cooler are the fans. They are a little loud compared to cheaper alternatives such as my Enermax liquid cooler on my other rig with same specs. Other than the fans being a little bit loud I really cannot complain.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Hentai

customer_reviews.title: Corsair to EVGA
customer_reviews.text: I had Corsair and then tried another. But this EVGA did the trick... In the past before this EVGA was available I purchased the Corsair and it did well for about 3 years then stopped cooling. So I installed another Corsair but the second didn't work well enough (no overclocking) CPU= 86F, 2011 6 core 3.4 GHz intel. EVGA 26F. I'm sold. I'll be looking to buy another EVGA when It's time. Haven't even played with the LED's yet.
customer_reviews.author: eraid0

customer_reviews.title: INSANELY LOUD FANS. Fan curve settings are bad.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this. The pump and radiator are fine. But the fans and software are really bad. The fan curve puts the fans at 100% at 60 degrees. And you CANNOT change that. So in games or whatever you're doing. ANY temp spike over 60 cranks the fans to full speed and they are insanely loud everyone in the house can hear them. I sent it back and ordered the corsair model with maglev fans, much better and the software is good.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works with NZXT Kraken G12
customer_reviews.text: This cooler fits on and works fine with the Kraken G12. I did have to slightly loosen the four silver screws around the outside ring of the bottom of the pump then insert into the bracket, turn it to lock it in then re-tighten the four screws. Very easy install and my EVGA 1080 ti FTW3 is nice and cool.
customer_reviews.author: Sath523

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great except
customer_reviews.text: The fans omg the fans burn them with fire they are so noisy. swaped them for a set of old cooler master blade masters and its perfect. cant even hear it after multiple hours of gaming. so summery. pump rad good. fans kill them and get noctua, coolermaster, really any other pwm fan out there
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: good performance, and value for the money
customer_reviews.text: this AIO works well, great performance, with the exception of noise. It will get noisy when you're putting load on CPU. Plus the pump design is last generation, so you won't get the latest greatest refinement or reliability improvements to it, but it is a better performing pump compared to the new one in Corsair
customer_reviews.author: F1racer

customer_reviews.title: 60°F taken off my Max temp
customer_reviews.text: I'm running this cooler on an i5 that was reaching about 150°F under full load, this immediately dropped the speed my temps climb at and dropped the max temp by 60°F down to 90°F, first water cooling setup and I couldn't be happier with it, well, maybe if they made one for my graphics card lol. Totally recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ETJAKEOC

customer_reviews.title: Big cooling, great price (when I got it)
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for less than I'd seen most 240mm AIOs (I think it was $75). For that price, it's amazing. It barely fit in my desktop (blocks one of the optical drive bays). The fan edges don't go all the way up, which supposedly improves airflow/noise, but also can let cables catch if you're not very careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan O Roskelley

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: I may be just an EVGA fanboy, but I like this cooler. It's not too over the top but looks good enough to fit with any build. It seems to be really well built and made of quality materials. And for the price it performs very well keeping my temps where I want. The only negative thing I have to say about it is that the pump is noisy. With my case panels on you don't hear it, but I was surprised by how much louder it was than my previous Corsair H80i. Overall I'm happy with it though.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen

customer_reviews.title: Comes with AM4 Bracket!
customer_reviews.text: Just to give everyone a heads up this came with the bracket for Ryzen CPU's. I even called EVGA and they told me they'd have to send me one after purchase, but this time they were incorrect! I hope this helps anyone else in doubt.
customer_reviews.author: bisxuit

customer_reviews.title: Dropped 30°F on average cpu temps
customer_reviews.text: Installing wasn't hard but the radiator does take up a lot of room. Wound up with the radiator inside the case, and the fans mounted to the radiators through the secondary fan locations between the 1st and 2nd case shrouds. Once that was figured out it was all set. The rgb works great with the downloaded evga software. Immediate and constant and consistent drop in temperatures, even under heavy load and overclocking. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Laura E Kram

customer_reviews.title: 120mm CL11 lacks AM4 support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it had AM4 support which it doesn't. If you buy this for a AMD Ryzen product, you will have to buy an Asetek AM4 mount for around $10-12 USD. With EVGA not supporting this, I would recommend another brand that does support AM4 on their 120mm AIO's out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: UZP Customs Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Good Cooler, bad fans
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest this cooler to anyone I know but the fans are fairly noisy and I have had to replace them once already through RMA just to have them still be loud and now it seems maybe a bearing broke in one of them. However, the cooler is great and keeps everything well within the limit. So again plan to buy better fans, not from EVGA.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: The pump is a nice Asetek refresh of Corsair's option
customer_reviews.text: The pump is a nice Asetek refresh of Corsair's option. I went with this one because Corsair C.S. has become garbage so I no longer support Corsair. The pump is as good as the H100i V2 for obvious reasons, but the software is pretty crummy. If you are used to using EVGA precision software for GPU overclocking then you will probably like the coolers' software. It looks the same. I much prefer Corsairs slightly less crummy software.
customer_reviews.author: KDC

customer_reviews.title: Nice and clean, keeps it cool, software a bit wonky but nbd
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy. Just had to swap the mounting bracket for my AMD Ryzen 5 2600. Thermal paste is preapplied, and the hardware is very sturdy and gave me no issues. The software (EVGA Flow Control), however, did freak me out at first. It was misreading my CPU temp as 78-81 deg C. Shut it down and verified the actual temp via BIOS. Must’ve been a glitch, but still. The software allows for some decent lighting customization and was easy to figure out. Definitely a fan of this product, and will probably upgrade to the bigger version when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Piffly

customer_reviews.title: fans are loud and annoying
customer_reviews.text: Well being a long time customer of evga im really disappointed in the fan quality after about month maybe longer started getting a whining noise and was coming from both of the 120 mm fans its so annoying even wearing headphones u can hear it, jist did a build for a friend and got a corsair he had it for 2 months now no issues as much as i love evga products im really upset and cant even return this thing now so have to go buy 2 new fans kinda upset .
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.text: Great product. The fans are quiet. Changing the LED colors is simple, and it looks nice. The cords aren't crazy bulky or anything. The design is fairly simple. Changed the direction on the fans so that the cords were on a different side. It was a bit of a pain to install it, but I think that was due to the case I have and how I can basically change everything, position-wise.
customer_reviews.author: Memz

customer_reviews.title: 20 degrees off from my RTX 2070 Super
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a cooler for my GPU with NZXT G12 Bracket. Works great. One thing I'd say is some people say its loud. Just set your curve correctly and it isnt bad. Yes if on full blast it can be a bit loud. It does a great job my current setup went from 70s Celsius with stock cooler to high 40s Celsius with an OC too. Love it. Will say it fits in bracket but not perfectly straight. The pictures I've included do not show stock fans they are on the other side you only see some aftermarket ones i set it as push pull with stock fans on bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Filipczuk

customer_reviews.title: Cost Effective Liquid Cooling Solution
customer_reviews.text: This is a no "frills" style liquid cooler. No flashing lights, no extra features, no bells, and no whistles. However, rest assured it does it job well. Given the nature of the product, I'm confident that anyone looking at this item is fully capable of installing it. The mounting backplate is not of the highest quality (some sort of hardened plastic), but it's study enough and I don't have any concerns now, with it installed. However, be careful not to break it beforehand. All things considered, and taking the price into consideration, I don't think anyone will be disappointed with this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Jared D.

customer_reviews.title: and the RGB logo is nice yet non-obtrusive
customer_reviews.text: I've found many of the 280 CLCs perform about the same. While I found the H115i to be sturdier (thicker tubing), I found the tubing on this to be more flexible and ultimately easier to work with without any concern of leaks or breaks. Plus it's cheaper (or it was for me), and the RGB logo is nice yet non-obtrusive. I prefer this over the H115i, but frankly, you could go either way and do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Amores

customer_reviews.title: Works well but the fans are loud
customer_reviews.text: I am running an Intel i7 8700k overclocked to 4.7Ghz. This cooler was idling at 28 to 34 Celsius and averaging 55-70 under load. Temperatures did reach 83 C during a 30 minute stress test but averaged about 65 C. I am using a push pull air confirguration on the radiator. The stock EVGA fans look good but are extremely loud. I am going to remove them and use some third party fans because the noise is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: I'm surprised with the performance of this cooler.
customer_reviews.text: This closed loop liquid cooler exceeded what I expected. But I have to mention, it is quite noisy. It keeps my i7 9700k not over 65 under load at all times, so I'm satisfied. If you are considering buying this product make sure you have a compatible case, because this thing is pretty big.
customer_reviews.author: Ivana Arostegui

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: Supposedly "quiet" according to reviewers. Let's set that straight now. Loud. LOUD at full tilt. LOOOOWD! And it's all due to the fan shroud design. Ridiculous! Cools very well though 🙂 Running this in intake configuration on your case will require removing fans and installing them in only one Orientation which is caused by the stupid fan shroud design. Great... Just stupid loud. Cools well. Yep.
customer_reviews.author: dimitri

customer_reviews.title: Best quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is an interesting option for those who want a liquid cooling system on their PC, although its price value in dominican republic is an expensive system. If you can only install a 120mm radiator in your system, i recommend you choose the EVGA CLC 120, as it is one of the best options within its segment, and in my opinion, the best quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amin EspinosaTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: It performs better than my 360 fractal design. Software help to dial in noise/performance, it also shows the coolant temperature!
customer_reviews.author: smee

customer_reviews.title: Loud fans very annoying
customer_reviews.text: This works just fine and I'm able to change the color. But these fans are super loud I'm a first time builder and these fans are horrible I'm definitely going to by more After market fans and swap them out for the radiator fans. It's really loud. If you buy this buy different fans too
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Not the quietest, but cools my stock i9-9900k amazingly
customer_reviews.text: I haven't overclocked my CPU (currently boost clock tho), but it's already showing amazing results at idle. It isn't quiet, but it isn't loud either. I would recommend switching out the fans for others, but if not, they aren't the worst. That being said, they perform better than my old Corsair AIO. Also the pre-applied thermal paste included with the AIO heatsink is what is being used for the results.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: EVGA 280mm CLC is monster cooler with relatively low noise.
customer_reviews.text: The EVGA CLC 280 is awesome, I upgraded from ARCTIC COOLING Liquid Freezer 240, I must say that EVGA fans are really powerful. The LED looks great and the software is simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot more than the Corsair AIO coolers ...
customer_reviews.text: Steal for $60, I like it a lot more than the Corsair AIO coolers I've had in the same price range. 7700k Rarely reaches 50+ after hours of gaming on ultra with a slight overclock. I was saving up for a nice EKWB setup but it's hard to justify more money when this little EVGA cooler along with my EVGA hybrid 1080 I get great temps consistently with a push/pull setup.
customer_reviews.author: RJ42

customer_reviews.title: AIO
customer_reviews.text: Generally a decent AIO. Not at all quiet, unless you keep fan speeds below 1500rpm. Software is usable if you configure it properly, starting in the bios. At idle, cpu temp can get within 2 deg of coolant temp if everything is set and case has good airflow..
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Nice Clean Look and lower temps!
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it four stars because I could not use the stock fans in the front location. Especially if you want them to be intake fans. I don’t think they would work as good installed reversed. Instead of the stock fans I used 2 Noctua NF-A14 chromax black fans. Overall, this a great cooler but not very versatile. I only had one location in my case to install it. If I could do it over I would have gone with a 360 cooler. However I am getting 4.3 GHz on my Ryzen 3600X with no manual OC and 50 C temps. With the stock cooler I only got 4.1 GHz with around 70 C temps.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Huge Difference!
customer_reviews.text: I was always running a stock cooler on an Intel I7 4790k chip. My case had a decent amount of fans which I thought would keep temps down. On a stock cooler at idle I was getting 37-40 degrees Celsius and during gaming it was around 80 degrees Celsius. Now after this water cooler install my idle temps are 27-29 degrees Celsius and during gaming 54-58 degrees Celsius. I would definitely recommend this cpu cooler. I can't judge the long term quality (yet) but I have always owned EVGA video cards. I had an issue with a video card and customer service was amazing with the free replacement. Great trusted company and a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Winner

customer_reviews.title: Great product, BUT i noticed something....
customer_reviews.text: The cooler itself works great, i havent noticed any high temps since install (i dont overclock) i do want to point out that the fan and pump need to be plugged in seprately, this was interesting because the cpu fan header should go to the fan and i dont have a second header for the pump, i just plugged the pump into a molex to 3pin adapter(the pump runs on 100% as it goes right to the power supply), also i noticed a clicking noise from the pump probably just airbubbles, so far so good, pretty easy on the eyes even without RGB, just to mention im using a noctua fan instead of the stock evga one
customer_reviews.author: Jacob B

customer_reviews.title: Nice N Cool
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Played games for 3 solid hours and CPU temp never went above 402211 degrees C. The 3 fans also seem to keep case temps down as well. The price was good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: A little louder but much cooler
customer_reviews.text: A little louder than my air cooler but about 10C cooler so I can't complain. Noise is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Fans are too loud at higher rpms
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be built well. Works good. Fans are controllable but running them anywhere past 1500rpms is like a wind tunnel , very loud. My CPU is a 8700k at stick turbo speeds 4.8 i games or even just working semi hard the CPU with this rad heats to 60c . On ideal after 4 days it idles at 25c with EiSt on. Once the voltage of the CPU gets past 1.0 she heats up quick and u need the fan speed increased. I ordered a 380 mm rad setup will see if I can get into the 50c gaming. This would be great prolly for an i5 or a lower class i7.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenie Aparo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Easy to install, brought my Temps way down in a case with an SLI setup, i.e. Lots of heat inside the case that was to much for the air cooler. Radiator was easy to install, good sized radiator too.if I had any complaint it's that the rbg controller is software, and doesn't work until you boot up and give it admin privileges. During which time the Evga logo is white and not my cases red theme.
customer_reviews.author: William Lawrence

product_meta.title: EVGA CLC 240mm All-In-One RGB LED CPU Liquid Cooler, 2x FX12 120mm PWM Fans, Intel, AMD, 5 YR Warranty, 400-HY-CL24-V1
product_meta.description: Size:CL24| Style:RGBThe EVGA CLC 240 liquid CPU cooler has arrived! This new liquid cooler from EVGA gives you incredible performance, low noise, and robust software controls. The full copper water block pulls the heat from your CPU to the radiator, where newly designed fans, Featuring Teflon Nano bearings, effortlessly disperse the heat. the CLC 240 offers premium sleeved tubing and fully controlled RGB LED to provide a sleek look.
feature_bullets: Compatible with Intel LGA2066/2011/2011-v3/1200/1150/1151/1155/1156/1366 and AMD AM2/AM3/AM4/FM1/FM2/TR4 and upcoming variants
Rgb LED's, can be synced to other EVGA RGB components
Unique EVGA fan design for reducing noise without sacrificing performance
Includes the software suite for monitoring and managing EVGA AIO's, EVGA flow Control. Airflow: 74. 82 CFM (Max)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,190 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
